title: Delta variant hits Taiwan, controversies on vaccines and testing; CCP: DPP creates disorder in HK to plot for independence
subtitle: IORG Dokidoki Alert Weekly Ôπã No. 4 Ôπè 2021.6.21-27

Do not eat sick Taiwanese pork

  • ‚ùå False information

Last week, aside from the pandemic, CCP propaganda included reproaching the ‚ÄúDPP authority‚Äù for ‚Äúcreating disorder in Hongkong to plot for independence.‚Äù On June 24th, Hongkong‚Äôs Apple Daily was forced to close. A narrative appeared on Facebook criticising the DPP for ‚Äúhaving double standards regarding the closing of Hongkong‚Äôs Apple Daily and Taiwan‚Äôs CTITV.‚Äù According to IORG‚Äôs database, there were 47 related Facebook posts between June 21st and 27th. The earliest post was found from the Facebook page of KMT Disciplinary Committee. Chinese state media Tong Shuo and pro-China content farm The Reacher echoed the same narrative.

Confirmed cases of the Delta variants in Pingtung County have attracted public attention and resurfaced the debate around universal testing for all inbound travellers (ÂÖ•Â¢ÉÊôÆÁØ©). IORG has found 244 Facebook posts of this narrative between June 21st and 27th and 6 occurrences of ‚Äúclustered posting,‚Äù sharing content such as articles from the content farm Mission (ÂØÜË®ä) and Fong News (Ê∫èÈ¢®Â†±). In our last Weekly, IORG has referenced a report by The Reporter in 2019, exposing Mission‚Äôs Chinese connections and its ‚Äúresurrection‚Äù with the new domain pplomo.com after being banned by Facebook in the same year.

Regarding Taiwan-made vaccines, 2 narratives have been identified in this Weekly ‚Äì ‚ÄúMedigen vaccine production is like a home factory,‚Äù ‚ÄúAn American-Taiwanese cockroach syndicate is manipulating UBI Asia‚Äôs stock for personal gain.‚Äù According to IORG‚Äôs database, the former narrative originated from a CTI YouTube video, which altered a video from CNN and added Chinese text overlay such as ‚Äúfailure to wear face mask during vaccine inspection,‚Äù inconsistent with the original report. This is an example of distorted content, a type of content manipulation. The later narrative originated from a Facebook post by Taiwanese commentator Huang Chih-hsien (ÈªÉÊô∫Ë≥¢). The post is built on a previous suspicious narrative that ‚ÄúBlackwater invested in UBI Asia vaccine R&D‚Äù and further claims that there is ‚Äúan American-Taiwanese cockroach syndicate‚Äù ‚Äúmanipulating UBI Asia‚Äôs stock for personal gain.‚Äù Chinese state media Straits Today (‰ªäÊó•Êµ∑Â≥Ω) shared Huang‚Äôs post.

3 claims in CTI video regarding Medigen vaccine production, clarifications from Medigen, editor‚Äôs opinion from Cofacts, and fact-checking from IORG. Source: CTI, announcement by Medigen via MOPS, TWSE, 2021/6/27 15:30, Cofacts„ÄÅCNN. Table by IORG.

Furthermore, the narrative that ‚Äúdark figures cause high mortality rate in Taiwan‚Äù requires further scientific verification. It is IORG‚Äôs opinion that both Taipei City Mayor Ko Wen-je (ÊüØÊñáÂì≤) and Taiwan‚Äôs Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) have yet to provide a clear description and verifiable evidence. However, Chinese state media Haiwai Net (Êµ∑Â§ñÁ∂≤) and Global Times (Áí∞ÁêÉÁ∂≤) both reported on Mayor Ko‚Äôs statement on June 24th.

In Weekly No. 2, IORG has introduced the false narrative ‚ÄúTaiwanese pork products tested excessive ractopamine in Hongkong‚Äù initiated by Chinese state media Hongkong Wonweipo (È¶ôÊ∏ØÊñáÂåØÂ†±), which might cause public concerns regarding Taiwanees pork and have an effect on the August referendums. In this Weekly, another false narrative targeting Taiwanese pork was identified. ‚ÄúDo not eat sick Taiwanese pork‚Äù was being spread with an audio file and a picture. This narrative has been verified by Taiwan Fact-check Center as false.

Full version of this Dokidoki Alert Weekly is available in Taiwanese Mandarin. Please visit https://iorg.tw/da/4 for more...
